speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Chapter Ten: The Lock Voice Feature. This is the most important workflow tool in the Voice Clone tab. Once you understand it, you will never want to work without it.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Normally, every time you click 'Clone Voice', the engine re-analyses your reference audio from scratch before it starts generating. This analysis step takes several seconds and repeats every single time.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: When you click 'Lock Voice', the engine performs that analysis exactly once and stores the resulting vocal data in memory. Every subsequent generation skips the analysis step entirely. You only generate new audio — the identity analysis is already cached.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The button label changes to 'Unlock Voice' when a voice is cached, confirming the lock is active. To change reference files, click Unlock Voice first to clear the cache, then load your new audio and lock again.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: This feature is essential for Batch Studio sessions. When the Batch Studio switches to a Clone block, it uses whatever voice is currently locked. If you lock a voice before running a scene, every Clone block in that scene uses the same cached identity without re-analysing.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: You can also save a Transcript Helper Profile that bundles the audio file and its transcript together. Load the profile into the Clone tab at any time to instantly restore your reference setup — and then lock it.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Please load Chapter Eleven: Batch Studio Sequencing. The Batch Studio is where all three engines come together.
